subject: Re: [junit] Testing a void method....
msgSnippet: ... But are we supposed to be testing our tools or our code? Should I also test the String object from the API? Because if that breaks, we re all in deep
messageBody:
On 8/28/06, Cédric Beust ♔ <cbeust@...> wrote:
> On 8/27/06, Chris Barham <cbarham@...> wrote:
> >
> > On 8/26/06, Truong, David <david_truong@...> wrote:
> >
> > >I have a question about testing a void method that it main purpose is to
> > >close a connection.
> >
> > pass it a mock connection which has an expectation of a call on to the
> > close
> > method.
>
>
> The danger with this approach is that if you upgrade your JDBC driver and
> that in the new version, close() is broken, your test will keep passing but
> your application will break...

But are we supposed to be testing our tools or our code? Should I also
test the String object from the API? Because if that breaks, we're all
in deep weeds. There comes a point where you need to trust
someone/something and run with it, otherwise you'll end up testing
everything including JUnit and neglecting your own code.

Simon
